title: Dieglman Island
text: Dieglman Island is an island about long that is largely ice covered but has numerous rock outcrops, lying on the northwest side of <a href="Edisto%20Channel">Edisto Channel</a> in the <a href="Highjump%20Archipelago">Highjump Archipelago</a>. First mapped from air photos taken by <a href="U.S.%20Navy%20Operation%20Highjump">U.S. Navy Operation Highjump</a>, 1946–47, and named the "Dieglman Islets", subsequent Soviet expeditions (1956–57) mapped the feature as one island with numerous outcrops. The name has been altered by the <a href="Advisory%20Committee%20on%20Antarctic%20Names">Advisory Committee on Antarctic Names</a> (US-ACAN) to apply to the single island. Named by US-ACAN for <a href="E.D.%20Dieglman">E.D. Dieglman</a>, an air crewman on U.S. Navy Operation Highjump photographic flights in this area in 1946–47.
